text: hello from Shanghai
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
No possible way it's linked to the rise of social media where everyone photoshops themselves and makes themselves look more beautiful and richer so teens constantly feel more insecure and incompetent

No way
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
Iceland (April or October) for peak northern lights/road trip heaven/be reminded of how small humans are

Colombia for history/food/beautiful people/hiking/beautiful views/rent a private island cause why not
author: Juliet_Shen

text: I would move to Asia just to have honey pomelo tea and milk tea readily available at every bar
author: Juliet_Shen

text: @avant__garbage was JUST telling me about how it can be easy to rabbit hole into Instagram's weirdness. These networks of accounts are common for all types of bad actors
author: Juliet_Shen

text: This is why it's crucial to have a diverse policy and safety team. Terrorism != Muslim extremists
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
I erroneously thought they stopped donating to anti-LGBTQ groups after the big big wave of backlash. 

Goodbye forever
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Agreed, my partner is a big Butteigieg fan but I've also seen that argument as the weird elephant in the room
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Is it that argument or is it moreso that Warren has more name recognition and thus a better chance of moving forward? I could see it go either way.
author: Juliet_Shen

text: It's good! I watched it on my flight over from the States, I think it's Zhang Ziyi's latest project
author: Juliet_Shen

text: And then you can be reincarnated and do it all over again
author: Juliet_Shen

text: UGH same with 無問西東 but that has a big dash of mainland Chinese patriotism thrown in
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Daphne Loves Derby for me plus the lead singers obscure project Wolftron
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Have you ever seen the music video for Jay Chou's 青花瓷? Watch it!!
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
I recently watched what I consider one of the most Chinese movies of all time on Netflix, 后来的我们/Us and Them.
* Bittersweet love story
* Never fully get together 
* Taking care of your parents
* Never forget where you came from

I have not cried like that in years
author: Juliet_Shen

text: 童话 is the common denominator for all Chinese people
author: Juliet_Shen

text: BUT THE CELL PHONE
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
If I could explain the difference in culture between East and West in one metaphor it's karaoke

West: fun party songs in front of a crowd in a bar

East: sad love ballads in a soundproof private room
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
YES. It's like I crave that ache in the soul constantly in music and film 

(emo and melodramatic but I'm Chinese so wtv I'm on brand)
author: Juliet_Shen

text: 90% of Chinese music = melancholy ballads. Actually just got into a deep conversation with my parents about generational trauma and overall sadness in Chinese culture lol
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Bumble launching Bumble Fund is such a boss move.
author: Juliet_Shen

text: ASIA TWEETING TIME LET'S GO
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Can someone do a follow-the-money investigation on Falun Gong and see if they're just funding anti-gay legislation or anti-China or anti-cult stuff or something
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Not only them. I think it was Asia Fortune? Fortune Asia? And some group dealing with commerce based in DC.
author: Juliet_Shen

text: I'm so mad at my auto correct grammar
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
There have also been whispers among the Asian American community of certain newspapers or organizations in Washington DC that receive funding from Falun Gong and thus are susceptible to influence. Can't remember which one's.

It sounds tin-hat but this entire thing is so surreal
author: Juliet_Shen

text: My parents also have stories of friends who "lost" their spouses to Falun Gong and had all their money stolen by them to fund the cult
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
I've personally grappled with this for years because I hear Chinese state media's take on Falun Gong but also don't know if their human rights accusations hold any weight 

(but also because when I explain what kind of dance I do I'm forced to reference Shen Yun)
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Don't forget the founder of Falun Gong "has been open about his beliefs that evolution is fraudulent, that people of different races will be separated in Heaven, and that homosexuality and promiscuity are unnatural. He told Time that aliens were attempting to control humans"
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
I remember working at an internet hotspot startup and answering customer emails and someone from a remote "school" for Shen Yun and Falun Gong hidden in the mountains somewhere in the US wrote in for tech assistance

This shit is weird af
author: Juliet_Shen

text: I am DEVOURING this. I'm so glad someone did a deep dive on Shen Yun and it's connection to Falun Gong. Thank you @jiatolentino for blessing us with this
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Can we leave "setting my Instagram to a business page and labeling it as Lifestyle even though it's just my Instagram" in 2019 pls
author: Juliet_Shen

text: I feel this so hard. I have to consciously dress more formally for days where I'm meeting people for the first time because sometimes people think I am an intern. I have no data, but I think Asian women experience on another level
author: Juliet_Shen

text: How do you fail art
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Awww yes. I used to eat this by the handful in lieu of popcorn for movies
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Bogota is AMAZING! Medellin too
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
This is from 2013 and things have "gotten better" since then but BJ air pollution could reduce your lifespan by 5.5 YEARS

Jesus
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Maybe this says more about my own personal anxiety that I'm frantically scouring NIH papers for studies on the health impact of air pollution as I take a train through hazy, blue tinted smog
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
This is from 2013 and things have "gotten better" since then but BJ air pollution could reduce your lifespan by 5.5 YEARS

Jesus 

https://grist-org.cdn.ampproject.org/v/s/grist.org/climate-energy/air-pollution-can-wreck-your-mental-health-too/amp/?amp_js_v=a2&amp_gsa=1&usqp=mq331AQCCAE%3D#aoh=15530447469340&csi=1&referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com&amp_tf=From%20%251%24s&ampshare=https%3A%2F%2Fgrist.org%2Fclimate-energy%2Fair-pollution-can-wreck-your-mental-health-too%2Famp%2F%23aoh%3D15530447469340%26csi%3D1%26referrer%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.google.com%26amp_tf%3DFrom%2520%25251%2524s …
author: Juliet_Shen

text: Besides the emotional impact of less sun (SAD), bleak hopelessness of living in a metropolis of poisonous air, and seeing your loved ones slowly get sick I'm sure there are major impacts to mental illness and increased risk there too
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
Physical impact: sore throat, blurry vision, shortness of breath, higher risk of cancer/asthma/heart attack/cardiovascular issues

Mental health impact: not nearly enough studies or research.
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
It was a semi clear sky in Beijing proper.

To combat the pollution (still pretty bad, AQI was 200+ yesterday) BJ moved many coal factories and other industries outside of the city. Now the suburbs, nearby Tianjin, even as far as Shanghai and Korea get the poisonous smog.
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
"is this pollution or fog?" 

A question I've asked too many times this trip
author: Juliet_Shen

text:
If I'm even remotely sick, I'm wearing a mask. Why would I want to spread my germs?

Also, filter masks in China are a must-have (AQI in Beijing is currently 185 )

text: @ehenkelsmusic any chance you flew to Beijing? I think I accidentally took your suitcase!
